instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG? PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG is a single phase of CPU VCORE before it is combined into PPVCORE_S0_CPU .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I had <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b dead board after water damage, after visual inspection noticed that <RESISTOR>R5077</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5078</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5079</RESISTOR> were destroyed i replaced them i got green light and fan spin but no chime i measured for VCORE and that was missing i followed one of Louis videos where he replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> AND <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> i did monkey see monkey do job, after replacement i had the same problem, so i started measuring and i noticed that i don have <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_UGATE1G</SIGNAL> on <TRANSISTOR>Q7500</TRANSISTOR> and that took me back to <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> i measure <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> they were fine but what i noticed that i don't have <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP</SIGNAL> i follow the rail i come to <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> and that rail took me to <CHIP>U5410</CHIP> and i noticed that i don have voltage on pin 4 and 5 so i jump wires from <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR>[SIZE=14px] [U][B]the computer turn on now everything is good[/B][/U][/SIZE] i just have [SIZE=14px][U][B][COLOR=#FF0000]small issue[/COLOR][/B][/U][/SIZE] that Louis mentioned in one of his videos but I can't find the video where on the LCD on the bottom part having [U][I][B][COLOR=#FF0000][SIZE=14px]bright dots all along the LCD length. Any ideas??? [/SIZE][/COLOR][/B][/I][/U]
